line_1: An' unco pack an' thick thegither;
line_2: Nae doubt but they were fain o' ither,

line_1: They're a run deils an' jads thegither.
line_2: But hear their absent thoughts o' ither,
To H—ll, if he's gane thither,

line_1: AS MAILIE, an' her lambs thegither,
line_2: Was ae day nibbling on the tether,

line_1: Now let us lay our heads thegither,
Now let us lay our heads thegither,
line_2: We've been owre lang unkenn'd to ither:

line_1: Now let us lay our heads thegither,
line_2: May Envy wallop in a tether,

line_1: In rhyme, or prose, or baith thegither,
line_2: Sae I've begun to scrawl, but whether

line_1: In rhyme, or prose, or baith thegither,
line_2: Or some hotch-potch that's rightly neither,

line_1: In rhyme, or prose, or baith thegither,
line_2: But I shall scribble down some blether

line_1: We've worn to crazy years thegither;
line_2: We'll toyte about wi' ane anither;

line_1: We've worn to crazy years thegither;
line_2: Wi' tentie care I'll slit thy tether,

line_1: We've worn to crazy years thegither;
line_2: Whare ye may nobly rax your leather,
Tho' whyles ye moistify your leather,
Till whare ye sit, on craps o' heather,
